clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Single-Arm, Open-Label, Multicenter Study of Hypotension Prevention and Treatment in Patients Receiving Arterial Pressure Monitoring With Acumen™ Hypotension Prediction Index Feature Software

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, single-arm, open-label, multicenter post-approval study to determine whether the use of the Acumen HPI Software to guide intraoperative hemodynamic management in non-cardiac surgery reduces the duration of intraoperative hypotension below a threshold of Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP)

primary_outcome.description: Duration (t [min]) reduction of intraoperative hypotension (defined as MAP < 65 mmHg for at least 1 minute) as compared with a historic retrospective control group

secondary_outcome.description: The determination of total area under the curve (time and MAP) for Intraoperative Hypotension in each subject. This endpoint is correlated with the duration and a descriptive analysis of this endpoint will be presented with the mean, standard deviation, median, minimum and maximum.

intervention.intervention_name: EV1000A Clinical Platform with Acumen Hypotension Prediction Index Feature Software
intervention.description: EV1000A Clinical Platform with Acumen Hypotension Prediction Index Feature Software

study_pop.textblock: Subjects recruited and enrolled should be classified as American Society of Anesthesiologist (ASA) physical status 3-4 who are scheduled for moderate-to-high-risk non-cardiac surgery and will be receiving pressure monitoring with an arterial line. Potentially qualifying patients will be evaluated during their preoperative anesthesia clinic visits.
